Comment 1: 
The convention is to put all Go files for a single package
in one directory.  Subdirectories contain other packages,
which must be referred to by explicit import statements.

If you want the files in the subdirectories to be in different
packages, add an import statement like

import "bitbucket.org/mikespook/gearman-go/src/gearman/client"
(and change the files in client/*.go to say package client)

and then refer to the pieces as client.Thing.

If you want the files in the subdirectories to be in the same
package as the parent directory, move them into the parent
directory.
